**Public Tender Announcement: Threat Risk Assessment Consultant Services**
===========================================================

**Title: Threat Risk Assessment Consultant Services**
--------------------------------------------------

**Reference Number:** MX-42958603940
**Solicitation Number:** NR23TRA1_80767

**Notice of Tender:**
Defense Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit proposals for providing Threat Risk Assessment Consultant Services to support the Department of National Defence (DND) requirements.

**Notice Type:**
This is a public tender announcement for the establishment of a Source List (SL) with 3 firms to provide Threat Risk Assessment Consultant Services on a "as and when required" basis.

**Tender Description:**
The SL will be established for a period of 2 years with a maximum estimated value of $2,000,000.00. The contract may be extended for up to 3 additional 1-year periods with a potential value increase of $2,000,000.00 at any time.

**Scope of Work:**
The SL will provide consulting services for the following activities:

* Project Manager
* Security Advisor - Senior
* Security Advisor - Intermediate
* Technical Advisor - Senior
* Total Classification Rate

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Proposals will be evaluated based on the criteria set out in the Solicitation Document.

**Document Availability:**
All bidding documents are available on the MERX website (www.merx.com). Fees may apply.

**Submission Guidelines:**
Submit proposals electronically through the MERX system by the closing date and time specified on the system.

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Keltie Léger at [keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca) or 343-542-5027.

**Notice Date:** November 29, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** January 25, 2024, 14:00 EST.
**Tender Status:** EXPIRED

**Trade Agreements:**
This procurement is subject to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).  Please refer to the official government website for further details.
